copy.headline: HOW TO CLAIM AN INHERITANCE
copy.subheadline: Depending on your inheritance plan package, you can choose to claim with Nunchuk service or recover it yourself.

microcopy.text: Have the Magic Phrase ready, along with either the Backup Password or the Inheritance Key seed phrase shared by the inheritance plan owner.
microcopy.purpose: Lists required materials for claim process

microcopy.text: Download the Nunchuk app from the App Store (IMPORTANT: please verify that the app was developed by Nunchuk). The claimant should sign up for their own account, separate from the owner's.
microcopy.context: Under step 02 - Download App and Create Account
microcopy.purpose: Security instruction and account setup guidance

microcopy.text: Sign in to the claimant's account on the mobile app. Go to the Services tab and tap Claim an inheritance. Enter the Magic Phrase if prompted, and provide any additional details requested, such as the Backup Password or the Inheritance Key seed phrase.

trustSignals: Emphasis on app verification to prevent spoofing
Requirement for separate accounts to prevent unauthorized access

copy.headline: HOW TO CLAIM AN INHERITANCE
copy.subheadline: Depending on your inheritance plan package, you can choose to claim with Nunchuk service or recover it yourself.

microcopy.text: Prepare the wallet configuration file (BSMS) if available, along with the Inheritance Key (the 12 or 24-word seed phrase) shared by the inheritance plan owner.
microcopy.purpose: Lists required materials for self-claim process

microcopy.text: You will need the Nunchuk application (mobile or desktop) to reconstruct the wallet and sign the transaction. You have two options for obtaining the software:
microcopy.purpose: Introduces two paths for app acquisition

microcopy.text: Option A: Official App Stores (Convenient) Download from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. (IMPORTANT: Verify that the app developer is listed as "Nunchuk".)
microcopy.purpose: First app acquisition option with security warning

microcopy.text: Option B: Open Source (Sovereign Backup) If the official stores are unavailable, or if you prefer to use the open-source version, use the desktop or Android (APK) versions directly from our official GitHub repositories below.
microcopy.purpose: Alternative path emphasizing sovereignty and offline security

trustSignals: Explicit mention of open-source availability and GitHub repositories
Labeling Option B as 'Sovereign Backup' appeals to security-conscious users
